texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I started working on the Ansible CIS playbook for CentOS and RHEL 6 back in 2014 and I've made a few changes to increase quality and make it easier to use.
texts.text: I started working on the Ansible CIS playbook for CentOS and RHEL 6 back in 2014 and I've made a few changes to increase quality and make it easier to use.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First off, the role itself is no longer a submodule. You can now just clone the repository and get rolling. This should reduce the time it takes to get started.
texts.text: First off, the role itself is no longer a submodule. You can now just clone the repository and get rolling. This should reduce the time it takes to get started.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Also, all pull requests to the repository now go through integration testing at Rackspace. Each pull request goes through the gauntlet:
texts.text: Also, all pull requests to the repository now go through integration testing at Rackspace. Each pull request goes through the gauntlet:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Travis-CI builds a server at Rackspace
texts.text: Travis-CI builds a server at Rackspace

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The entire Ansible playbook runs on the Rackspace Cloud Server
texts.text: The entire Ansible playbook runs on the Rackspace Cloud Server

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Results are sent back to GitHub
texts.text: Results are sent back to GitHub

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The testing process usually takes under five minutes.
texts.text: The testing process usually takes under five minutes.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Stay tuned: Updates are coming for RHEL and CentOS 7. ;)
texts.text: Stay tuned: Updates are coming for RHEL and CentOS 7. ;)
